docs.summary: Merchant information.

members.name: country
members.doc: Resolved country in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

members.name: paymentsAllowed
members.doc:
True when has business premium allowing to accept payments.
 TODO:PAY-!! Techwriter should approve "premium" naming part

members.name: email
members.doc:
Email of the merchant. It's either the business email (configured per site)
 or the registration email.

members.name: paymentProviderId
members.doc: Provider id recommended to connect with this payment method type.

docs.summary:
The payment method is the way that a buyer chooses to compensate merchants. It can either be cash, credit card, PayPal account or some other Wallet.
The list of supported Payment Methods vary country by country.
During the checkout flow, buyers deal only with payment methods, not with payment providers.
Every payment provider supports at least one payment method. For example, Wix Payments supports credit cards, iDeal, Sofort and Apple Pay. Square supports credit cards and point of sale (PoS).
Payment Methods are provided by Payment providers. Only one Payment method can be provided by only one Payment provider at the same point of time.

members.name: paymentProviderInfos
members.doc:
Provider Ids recommended to connect with this payment method type.
 Sorted from most recommended ones.

docs.summary:
Money.
 Default format to use. Sufficiently compliant with majority of standards: w3c, ISO 4217, ISO 20022, ISO 8583:2003.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (e.g., 3.99). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be valid ISO 4217 currency code (e.g., USD).

members.name: paymentMethodTypeId
members.doc: Id of a Payment Method Type.

members.name: fee
members.doc: Provider's fees on a payment method type

members.name: supportRecurring
members.doc: Recurring payments supported by payment provider.

members.name: brands
members.doc: Payment brands supported by payment provider.

members.name: minimum
members.doc: Fee is just starting from amount.

members.name: formattedMinimumFee
members.doc:
Fee description to a Merchant
 TODO:PAY-!!! Rename it to formatted_fee or something else

members.doc:

docs.summary:
Service that authorises payment method processing. The gateway may be provided by a bank or by a specialised financial service provider as a separate service.
In a nutshell, a payment provider is a service that moves money from a buyer to the merchant.
Here are few examples of payment providers:
- Wix Payments
- PayPal
- Stripe
- [See full list](https://support.wix.com/en/article/available-payment-providers-6803928)

members.name: installments
members.doc:
Installments
 TODO:PAY-!!!! Installments are stored in meta per method, need to aggregate it here somehow

members.name: providerHelpUrl
members.doc: Help page on a providers web site.

docs.summary:
Payment Provider Account represents the connection to the Payment provider that provides a certain list of Payment methods.
From Merchant perspective the connection can be established in the different ways:
- **Direct**: Merchant provides required keys directly to us. Please note that every provider requires a different set of keys in its credentials: they may have different names, and their quantity varies (e.g. 1, 2 or more).
- **OAuth**: Merchant is redirected to the payment provider site, where the merchant can confirm connection.
The exact way depends on the way Payment provider works.
### Statuses of Payment Provider Account
Each Payment Provider Account has a status. Statuses include:
- **UNDEFINED**: Status is unknown.
- **OK**: Account has been successfully connected, can process Payments and receive Payouts.
- **ACCEPTING_PAYINS_ONLY**: Account has been successfully connected, can process Payments, but cannot receive Payouts.
- **PAYMENTS_BLOCKED**: Account has been successfully connected, but pay-ins and pay-outs are disabled because an action from the Merchant is required on a Payment Provider side.
- **ACCOUNT_CREATION_PENDING**: Account wasn't created yet
- **ACCOUNT_CREATION_FAILED**: Account creation failed
- **SUSPENDED**: Both pay-ins and pay-outs are blocked because of the issue with the Account
- **BLOCKED**: Account is not functional and was closed by the Payment provider.
### Action items of Payment Provider Account
Each Payment Provider Account has a status. Statuses include:
- **NONE**: No action item provided.
- **CLAIM_ACCOUNT_TO_ENABLE_PAYOUT**: Merchant should claim account on a provider side to enable pay-outs.
- **CLAIM_ACCOUNT_TO_ENABLE_PAYOUT_OR_BE_SUSPENDED**: Merchant must claim account on a provider side to enable pay-outs and prevent refund since one has some pay-ins.
- **CLAIM_ACCOUNT_TO_ENABLE_PAYIN**: Merchant should claim account on a provider side to enable pay-ins.

members.name: paymentProviderId
members.doc: Payment provider id. For example, `com.wix.wixpay.us`, `payPal` or `com.stripe`.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the account on the provider side.
- **UNDEFINED**: Status is unknown.
- **OK**: Account has been successfully connected, can process Payments and receive Payouts.
- **ACCEPTING_PAYINS_ONLY**: Account has been successfully connected, can process Payments, but cannot receive Payouts.
- **PAYMENTS_BLOCKED**: Account has been successfully connected, but pay-ins and pay-outs are disabled because an action from the Merchant is required on a Payment Provider side.
- **ACCOUNT_CREATION_PENDING**: Account wasn't created yet
- **ACCOUNT_CREATION_FAILED**: Account creation failed
- **SUSPENDED**: Both pay-ins and pay-outs are blocked because of the issue with the Account
- **BLOCKED**: Account is not functional and was closed by the Payment provider.

members.name: requiredAction
members.doc:
Action required from a Merchant on the provider side.
- **NONE**: No action item provided.
- **CLAIM_ACCOUNT_TO_ENABLE_PAYOUT**: Merchant should claim account on a provider side to enable pay-outs.
- **CLAIM_ACCOUNT_TO_ENABLE_PAYOUT_OR_BE_SUSPENDED**: Merchant must claim account on a provider side to enable pay-outs and prevent refund since one has some pay-ins.
- **CLAIM_ACCOUNT_TO_ENABLE_PAYIN**: Merchant should claim account on a provider side to enable pay-ins.

members.name: providerAccountName
members.doc:
Name of the account on the provider side. In some cases it's email, but it
 can be anything. Safe to show to the users.

members.name: providerAccountId
members.doc:
Id of the account on the provider side.
 Safe to show to the users.

members.name: country
members.doc: Country of the account on the provider side.

members.name: installments
members.doc:
Installments settings. When they are not present, it means that either the merchant has disabled this feature, or
 the provider does not support it.

members.name: paymentMethodTypeSetups
members.doc: Connected to the provider account payment method type setups.

members.name: minInstallments
members.doc: Minimum installments available for a Buyer.

members.name: maxInstallments
members.doc: Maximum installments available for a Buyer.

members.name: minAmount
members.doc: Minimum installment amount available for a Buyer.

members.name: paymentMethodTypeId
members.doc: Payment method id. For example, `creditCard` or `payPal`.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether merchant has had selected this method to be available for making purchases.

members.name: instructions
members.doc: Text instructions for a Buyer how to use payment method.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • STRING - Plain string
  • CHECKBOX - Boolean checkbox
  • DROPDOWN - Dropdown
  • RICH_TEXT - Multiline text

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • OK
  • ACCEPTING_PAYINS_ONLY
  • PAYMENTS_BLOCKED
  • ACCOUNT_CREATION_PENDING
  • BLOCKED
  • SUSPENDED
  • ACCOUNT_CREATION_FAILED

Possible values are:
  • NONE
  • CLAIM_ACCOUNT_TO_ENABLE_PAYOUT
  • CLAIM_ACCOUNT_TO_ENABLE_PAYOUT_AND_AVOID_SUSPENSION - CLAIM_ACCOUNT = 2; // Merchant should submit Know Your Customer form.
  • CLAIM_ACCOUNT_TO_ENABLE_PAYIN - UPDATE_KYC = 4; // Merhcant should update Know Your Customer form.
